author: {'steamid': '76561197997912303', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1530037815}
review:
[h1]Game locks up computer, Developers refuse any kind of support[/h1]

The game(s) (Anomaly 1, 2 and every single addon) shows the starting menu but locks up the whole computer when trying to start a new game. Even the usual key shortcuts do not help, 
When I asked the Support about that they claimed that I had the wrong Linux version and ceased communication despite that this problem also occured with Ubuntu (the only supported Linux version) and Mint being a direct derivative of Ubuntu:
http://steamcommunity.com/app/236730/discussions/0/451848854999379266/

Instead the support suggested that I simply request a refund.

Never again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041949592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 605, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1529530262}
review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a Tower Defence Sci-fi game.


[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

[b]Video Settings information.[/b]

[list]
    [*]There are many different resolution sizes available.
    [*]You can play in fullscreen or windowed mode.
[/list]

[b]Volume Settings Information.[/b]

[list]
    [*]You can change the music volume between 0-10.
    [*]You can change the Sound effects volume between 0-10.
    [*]You can change the Voice volume between 0-10.
[/list]

[b]Miscellaneous Information.[/b]


[list]
    [*]There are some different languages available. 
    [*]There is a difficulty level settings available.
[/list]

[h1]About the game.[/h1]

This is one of those typical Tower defence games. Enemies will go on a monorail and you will have to put defenses on the side of the Rail. Your defenses will have to destroy the enemy before they will reach your core. Enemies will be firing back at your Defenses and you will have to repair them from time to time otherwise they will get destroyed. Killing enemies will drop resources and you will have to click on the resources in order to obtain them. They will also drop 1 energy which could be used for repairing once you have collected 4 of them. Repairing is not just repairing, It's giving the defense unit a small amount of time some health regeneration along with it.

Later on you will have to place harvesters to gain an extra income to upgrade your towers and place even more defenses. Harvesters will eventually run out of their tile. You can sell them and replace a tower instead on their spot.

After each mission you will get some TP which you could spend to upgrade your arsenal. There is a small Tech-web available and each has a different category. Towers, Economy, Upgrades and other things. However once you have gained some TP in a mission, you are not able to gain the SAME TP again and only the remaining ones that you haven't obtained yet.

[b]Ingame Information.[/b]

[list]
    [*]No tutorial but you do get hints from time to time.
    [*]Graphics are alright.
    [*]Sound/music is alright too.
    [*]It's a calm game.
    [*]You can build harvesters to get extra money, gain money from killed enemies or energy drops.
    [*]Difficulty changes the gameplay, As some structures or tower pads will be removed from play.
    [*]You can upgrade and repair your defenses.
    [*]You can re-do previous levels on different difficulties.
    [*]There is a pause button and speed up button But no button to instantly the next wave.
    [*]There is no such thing as "pedia" but you are able to hover your mouse over an unit to get some information.
[/list]


[b]Miscellaneous Information.[/b]


[list]
    [*]None.
[/list]

[h1]Other things.[/h1]

The game is 10 bucks, My perspective its an ok price but surely can drop 6 bucks lower. If you aren't sure what you will expect from the game you may want to get this in a discount.

-------------------


[quote] Reviews are always uploaded if i have at least played for 2 hours or more. Unless the game is really garbage and doesn't deserve the 2H limit.[/quote]

I Give this game a 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198032892782', 'num_games_owned': 1323, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1528299980}
review:
Probably the most limited tower defense game I played in ages:
- limited amount of spawn spots for towers, even fewer of them are useful as majority of them leave towers extremely vulnerable.
- limited amount of places were you can spawn certain tower types, plus there are big towers that block adjacent spots.
- some towers are very ineffective against most enemies, like the Behemoth tower was a very scary foe in the previous games, yet in this one it barely scratches paint of most units. It was a tower that you wanted to destroy ASAP or avoid entirely, now it's pathetic.
- tech tree looks like a gimmick feature since it doesn't allow you to unlock anything until you reach a certain level.

The game itself looks like a smartphone port: 
- no keyboard shortucts,
- no option to disable hints: "you can replay earlier levels on higher difficulty (and to listen every single hint for a second time!)"

Imho, the game series quality went downhill with every single game: gameplay, story, the game engine, gameplay elements.
I liked playing as elite squad, heroes that went on suicide mission in uncharted territory in 1st game. 
Playing as young vengeful commander in 2nd game was annoying.
In 3rd game you play as some unknown entity that gets praised by a robogirl all the time, and instead of controlling soldiers that used to say some cool phrases you control silent tosters.

I can't say that the game is bad though, but there were better games both in the game series and in this genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981624277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 311, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1531850811}
review:
Verdict: Meh, Prime world defenders is better, so is Warstone TD, etc. etc.


A TD where you need to pause to issue commands/repairs. Playing on Hard was challenging but overall the game is easy.

3 difficulties offer you more research points. However even though my launch pad (base) took damage I still got all the promised tech points out of a hard mission. Therefore the game is relatively easy as there's no "perfect" bonus.

Tech tree is nice and would have pushed  this into a good game if everything wasn't locked behind mission levels. In other words [i] Hey you have a lot of choice on how to spend your points, go nuts! Oh, you can't go that far because you haven't done that mission[/i]
That essentially restricts the game in many ways. I'm sure the developers liked it but there's only the illusion of variety.

review: Anomaly Defenders √® l'ultimo cappitolo della saga (per lo meno √® l'ultimo quando scrivo questa recensione) Anomaly. In questo capitolo capovolge completamente i ruoli, infatti ora non saremo pi√π dalla parte degli umani ma aiuteremo gli alieni a fuggire. Per fare ci√≤ usaremo le torri quindi ci difenderemo dagli attacchi che abbiamo sempre usato nei precedenti capitoli. Anche se parlando in generale non c'√® nulla di nuovo sotto il sole, visto che i tower-defense esistono da parecchio, questo capovolgere la situazione per la trama lo trovo abbastanza simpatico. Le torri avranno i loro sistema di potenziamento acquistabile fra una missione e l'altra e in pi√π avremmo le nostre abilit√† da comandante (visti nei precedenti capitoli) che ci verranno in nostro aiuto. Che dire se vi piaciono i tower defense questo titolo fa per voi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263427469', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 973, 'last_played': 1514322297}
review:
The hardest TD game I played for last years.

I didn't expect much, because I tried the previous game in the series, Anomaly Warzone Earth and I didnt like it. But I bought this game anyway to check. And..I got impressed.

This is classical TD with some new features. Enemies, human forces, are trying to reach the core. You need to place towers to destroy them. BUT.... In this game, enemies can attack and destroy your towers. BUT2.. If you lost your tower you wont get your money back. So it's really important to keep your towers alive.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1245953854

You can a lot of tools to do it. You can repaiur towers, you can protect them skills and you can sell them. The last thing you will do often.

So basically the gameplay looks like  (on hard)... Enemies come. You place towers which are good against them. They attack first tower. You are repairing it and selling at the same time. They attack other towers. You do the same. For money proceeds from sale you place new towers and finally destroy enemy wave. Then you sell all towers and build new type of tower in the start of the path, cause new enemies com. You will sell tower really really often, because enemy constantly changes armor types and incoming paths.

After completing each mission, you get tech points which you can spend on various upgrades in 'skill tree'. You can unlock new towers, upgrade them or getting perks (tower deals +15% damage and etc). Even if you pass whole game you wouldn't be able to research everything. Also, different missions requires different "skill tree"setups.

There are 6 towers types. Each can be upgraded 3 times. Towers are different, so there is no best tower in all situation. There are not much enemy types. I would like to see more diversity in them, but it was enough to keep me playing.

Some missions very challenging. And I liked it really much, because new TD mostly very easy for me.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1245953773

Pros
- Enemies can attack/destroy towers
- Interesting skill tree mechanic
- Really challenging game
- Nice visaul effects and soundtrack

Neutral
- The game requires a lot of micromanagement. Hardcore gamers would like it, but casual would find this annoying
- Enemies constantly changes paths. It adds even more micromanagement, because you constantly need to sell towers from 1 path and add to another. But it gives the game for strategy potential.
- You lost money if tower got destroyed. It adds more challenge, but it can be really hard for casual players, because enemy can destroy tower in 2-4 seconds.

Cons
- You can't see exact numbers of damage, attack speed, enemy health and etc.
- A lack of diversity of enemy units

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1245953926

[h1]Resume[/h1]
The game is a real challenge on hard difficulty. I liked the new features in TD genre. I had great time. I recommed this game for casual TD fans and strategy gamers for a full price!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971745805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1522355573}
review:
A good addition to the Anomaly games. This time it's a standard tower defense game again, but well executed with decent graphics, sounds and solid gameplay. If you like tower defense games, you cannot really go wrong with Anomaly Defenders, especially if you are also a fan of the Anomaly's series. 

Positives:
+ good graphics and sounds, and Anomaly-like towers.
+ decent amount of maps.
+ solid techtree (/upgrades between maps) and also abilities which costs energy.
+ can place refinery-like structure that draws attention of enemies.
+ varied selection of towers that offers distinctive advantages and disadvantages.
+ while limited amount of enemy types, they are different enough compared to each other.

Negatives:
- brings nothing new to the table, hence can feel a bit repetive if you played alot of tower defense games. 
- energy points need to be clicked manually, which can be a bit annoying and feels like an artificial feature to keep the player busy.
- first dozen of maps feel a bit limited in terms of unlocked tech/towers and enemy types. They could have introduced all the content a bit quicker.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150727982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 1638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1589, 'last_played': 1519921882}
review: Anomaly Defenders ist ein gutes letztes Hurra f√ºr die Tower Defense Serie von 11 Bit Studios. Es hat wundersch√∂ne Karten, spa√üiges und hektisches Gameplay und viele strategische M√∂glichkeiten √ºber die einsetzbaren Kr√§fte und den komplexen Tech-Tree. Au√üerdem sind die Schwierigkeitsgrade, die das Layout der Karten beeinflussen, ziemlich beeindruckend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042243404', 'num_games_owned': 729, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1497464122}
review: A TD Game that requires your full attention just about 100% of the time.  You can't just make towers, sit back and watch the fun, you have to constantly click on things, buff towers, gather resources (to an extent), and micromanage almost every tower in the later waves of enemies.  It's fun at first, feels a little different, but quickly loses that luster when you realize just how much clicking you'll actually be doing.  Would suggest watching a few videos of the gameplay before you try this one out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041849194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1510551689}
review:
This game is a reskin version of old school TD with some new feature, easy to play. I have played Anomaly series since warzone earth so i am very excited when playing this game.
+ Graphics
+ Tech tree
+ Challenging
+ Plenty of maps
+ Energy bar is an interesting concept and requires more tactical placement of your towers

author: {'steamid': '76561198024050400', 'num_games_owned': 506, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 3056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1759, 'last_played': 1517202380}
review:
Very good TD... unique way in diverting enemy waves.  A chore to get final achievement though (if you finish Hard, you'd still have to finish Easy too, so it's recommended to finish on Easy first).  If you like TDs, you'd have to get this, it's both challenging and enjoyable.

Sad to say goodbye... Hoping for a sequel, even tho it's unlikely given the huge success of This War of Mine, etc

9/10

Il s'agit d'un bon jeu, un tower defense r√©ussi reprenant les unit√©s des autres jeux de la s√©rie.
Mais ce qui vait fait la force de ces jeux c'est qu'il s'agit de Tower Offense, pas Tower Defense ! Donc avec ce jeu la s√©rie perd toute son originalit√© et tombe dans le banal. Dommage, parce qu'il est plut√¥t r√©ussi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156471063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1514242331}
review:
Demasiado largo para mi gusto, y definitivamente no tuvo ni de cerca la magia de sus anteriores 3 entregas... pero bueno, es un Anomaly, lo "rescato" hasta ahi.
Y el punto del juego de invertir la tematica exactamente al revez, me encant√≥, pero bueno, hacer misiones porque si, sin motivaci√≥n no tiene chiste, y hasta cierto punto no se si podria recomendarlo como compra en solitario, pero si el Humble en cuesti√≥n.





Como juego: bueno, aceptable y una pizca de originalidad.
Como Anomaly: no, o muy poco, realmente no lo es, pero insisto, si lo compras con el pack, no viene mal jugar este como ultimo, y es disfrutable.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198033923433', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1512229279}
review:
A bare-bones tower defense that, despite having active pause and time controls, focuses on reflexes and constant clicking. (Case in point: one of two resources has to be manually picked up, has expiration date [i]and[/i] is capped.) If you like these, go read other reviews.

If you're looking for a TD with deep tactical decisions, this is not the game for you. (If you are - try [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/218410/Defenders_Quest_Valley_of_the_Forgotten_DX_edition/][i]Defender's Quest[/i][/url] or, if you're looking for sort-of-TD, try [i]Creeper World 3[/i]'s demo.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198000461284', 'num_games_owned': 1742, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 1288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1288, 'last_played': 1505424313}
review:
Fixed paths and launchpads. What do i mean with fixed launchpads? As soon as you start either 1 of 3 difficulty levels you will see spawned launchpads in your missions the fact that i can't spawn tower how i want and where i want to position them is total b.s. e.g. scorchers, these towers were useless to me because each time i saw pad to spawn on game said there is no ROAD, lmao. Can't design your own "maze" like for example Defense grid or Sanctum. 

I had to do several restarts because of missed unit or built wrong tower just because there is no rewind button. 0 replay value unless you want to force yourself to collect 100% achievements aside from that play on easy and complete campaign. Annoying in game mission briefings that can't be disabled.

WHAT happened to all towers that were in previous anomaly games? Huh? Why there are missing some? I wanted to experience same thing i did in other Anomaly games. Oh yes "some" hazard missions are astonishing you would think that if there is actual hazard mission that could benefit your play style, nope, you are completely wrong because all hazards are against you. Bombing missions always target your towers as well as you run out of energy to repair them and then enemy units get pass you. OH HOW FUN! If that is done then there is next hazard mission where lightning strikes down. That could benefit you here at least? OH no! haha, its even worse than it was with bombing hazard. As soon as lightning strikes it shuts down your towers and the thing is about lightning it only targets your spawned towers and if you have only 3 towers on field then it will be perma locked down. AMAZING!

Not sure why but whenever i fast forward gameplay and there are several explosions i got FPS drops. HOW CAN I GET FPS DROPS WITH 1050TI? For real?
I actually tortured myself to play all the way till the end and collect all 100% achievements. I'm so glad this is over.

Here is the tip. If you want good tower defense game with actual replay value get DEFENSE GRID or SANCTUM instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994056558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 205, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1505089157}
review:
The first Anomaly game was fantastic. I can only assume the second one was also pretty good.

Anomaly Defenders on the other hand plays like a terrible mobile rip off. They got rid of all the hotkeys except to pause and speed up. If you want to build, upgrade, or use abilities, it's all click spam. If that wasn't bad enough, you don't even automatically accumulate energy for your abilities; they make you click EVEN MORE on friggin' bubbles that spawn on dead enemies. WTF?! If you're not going to fix awful mobile mechanics for PC, at least let us click and drag. Remember that game Godus that everyone was disappointed in? That's like this game.

What the hell devs. This game should not have come to PC, because it's a frickin' mobile game through and through. Just don't bother, play the other two Anomaly games which are actually decent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048659492', 'num_games_owned': 5460, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 1437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1437, 'last_played': 1413145786}
review:
Anomaly Defenders is a tower-defense game from 11 bit studios and one of the game of the Anomaly franchise.

After the aliens failed to attack earth the tide has turned. Now its time for the humans to take revenge and invade the aliens. Additionally, this time you play as the aliens and your task to stop the invading human forces.

The game itself is just awesome, well balanced and challenging. The harder difficulties really challenging, the variety of towers, its upgrades offers you a huge strategic variety. The graphic is pretty decent for a tower defense game.

This game definetly worth its price, very fun for its 8 hours gameplay and offers more if you up for challenges and you would try harder difficulties.

So what are you waiting for Hive Commander? Stop the intruder human forces! Save the alien homeland!

As your Average Achievement Hunter ill share some informations about achievements:
20 steam acheivements. Most of them pretty easy, build 10 of each towers on a single map, reach some technology levels, but its very hard to perfect this game. Finishing all mission on ALL difficulty levels very challenging. If you fail on that, its still a 80-95% game so not a huge hit to your average game completion. The fun this game offers worth it.
Time to 100%: 20-30h, based on strategical thinking skill

author: {'steamid': '76561198021887339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1418880033}
review:
It was long ago that I played this game, but I marked it as one of the few games that I call "Games that were Well Worth It", by that I mean worth the price I paid. As such I feel it deserves my thumbs up (years later, whoops, haha).
This is a pretty cool tower defense game based on the fabulous mechanics of Anomoly and Anomoly 2. The graphics seemed toned down a little but it still looks good. The levels look cool and I'm a huge fan of tower defense games that don't rely on maze-building. There are a good selection of towers and upgrades to them that allows for some good variety of tactical decision-making by the player. The types of enemies encourage good decision making.

I played this game until I felt I got everything I wanted out of it, which ended at 12.6 hours. That said, I'm the kind of player who jumps around to different games on the same day; I don't often play one single game for hours on end. This makes it a challenge for me to complete a game. I completed this game (not 100%) and I'm happy.

Recommend for a good time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010180088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1492197491}
review:
[b]This is a long review, so if you want a brief summary of why I recommend [b]Anomaly Defenders[/b] skip to [u]Results[/u] and read from there.[/b]

11 Bit Studios provides us with a relatively standard Tower Defense game that differs from their usual options. Anomaly Defends may be relatively generic when it comes to tower defense games, but it‚Äôs unique campaign, interesting maps, and variety of opponents provide a fun game worth a playthrough.  

[b]Story:[/b]
You play as the world‚Äôs best strategist, a human commander, who opted to avoid a genocide and joined up with a Ylamona, a sentient alien AI, to defend the Anomaly. Every mission is another step to holding off the human onslaught as you defend the Anomaly escape pod. 

[b]Campaign:[/b]
A fantastic game to start playing for the Anomaly series. I originally started by playing the first few missions of ‚ÄúAnomaly 2‚Äù. Then I went back and started playing ‚ÄúAnomaly Defenders‚Äù, which allowed me to understand all the turrets you‚Äôll see in later installments. The campaign is well laid out and the technology tree allows you to specialize your strategy for the map. You can reset the tree at any time, meaning you can plan your mission based on your technology limitations. 
There is a total of 24 missions each one with three difficulty settings. Each difficulty has a reward of ‚ÄúTechnology Points‚Äù. Typically, hard gives two more points than easy and one more than normal; although, on mission 23 and 24 you can receive two more ‚ÄúTechnology Points‚Äù for beating the levels on hard. 
The difficult curves well throughout the game, and depending on how you invest your points determines how difficult the campaign will be. Each level has nuisances that make them all rather unique, from either multiple enemy spawn points, harvester locations, air support pathways, etc. 

[b]Gameplay:[/b]
Overall the gameplay is relatively smooth, the camera angle is great and the zoom is fine. The screen movement works well, and the turret management is easy. Some issues tend to occur when placing ‚ÄúStormers‚Äù, which are ‚ÄúHuge‚Äù in tower size. Oddly they are actually one of the smallest towers physically. I found myself not using any of the ‚ÄúFunctions‚Äù from the technology tree, mostly because I didn‚Äôt upgrade them. I instead vested all my points on ‚ÄúPerks‚Äù, ‚ÄúTowers‚Äù, and ‚ÄúTowers‚Äù. Two of the perk lines have the same name, hence why I wrote ‚ÄúTowers‚Äù twice. 

[b]Hints:[/b][spoiler]
>Upgrade ‚ÄúCriticals‚Äù, the damage multiplier is huge at max level and the rate of fire on most towers is fast enough that they almost always hit critical hits.
>Upgrading ‚ÄúBuying‚Äù makes the towers not only cost cheaper, but their upgrades cheaper as well.
>I found myself using mostly ‚ÄúBlaster‚Äù towers, upgrading them to max early makes them incredibly powerful.
>Harvester can be used to pull enemies away from the main path, although when it goes into ‚ÄúDefense Mode‚Äù the next spawn will no longer head toward the tower. Repair it to bring it back to standard mode if you still want to pull enemies down the pathway. 
>If you have trouble with a level, beat it on easy, then when you‚Äôre stronger come back and play it on ‚ÄúNormal‚Äù or ‚ÄúHard‚Äù for more technology points.
>If you‚Äôre stuck, go back and play old levels to get more Technology Points and beef yourself up. [/spoiler]

[b]Results:[/b]
Overall I‚Äôd recommend Anomaly Defenders. It offers great variety of maps, enemies, and abilities that provide a dynamic playthrough on every level. You could easily play through this game in one day as the campaign is ‚Äúrelatively‚Äù short; although, at the right price point this came provides good value for money. I personally purchased this on sale, and for 75% off I would say it was worth every penny. 

Pros:
+Technology tree that allows you to choose your strategic pathway ‚Äì focus on tower strength, passives, abilities, or supporting towers.
+Dynamic enemies that provide challenging gameplay.
+Environmental factors that boost strategic methodology.
+Easy to come back too ‚Äì the story isn‚Äôt compelling enough to make you play the next level, so you can enjoy a more relaxing Tower Defense experience. 

Cons:
-Would have liked to have circle or build area around towers to understand exactly where a ‚ÄúHuge‚Äù vs. ‚ÄúLarge‚Äù tower differed. The game grays out adjacent tiles that cannot be built on because of the tower, but it doesn‚Äôt give you an exact AOE as it does with the towers range.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983740996', 'num_games_owned': 746, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 1765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1765, 'last_played': 1486417425}
review:
A strange message reaches you from Ylamena. An alien requesting your help. Help against the human race to protect the aliens from final distinction. As the greatest strategist in the universe the aliens turn to you in their despair hope for rescue.

Well, so much for the rather strange story. Calling a human to defend an alien race against invading humans?! Since humans are used to kill humans all the time - watch the news, or pay attention in your history lesson - why not. What's in it for me, you may ask. A whole lot of fun, I'd say.

In case you have played any other part of the Anomaly series, you know that usually you play as the attacker, not the defender. But this time it's really a tower defence game. And it's a really good one.

Pros.
- very nice graphics, I really like this style
- brilliant music
- option to pause
- great female voice acting
- interesting combination of towers
- special tower abilities
- money is earned by installing harvesters while killing humans earns you points to activate special abilities
- very addictive
- 2x speed
- 24 levels with three difficulties

Cons:
- beating some of the higher levels on hard difficulty is only possible with an enormously huge amount of micro management. You can only win some games in hard difficulty by stopping like every two to three seconds. It's crazy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012925597', 'num_games_owned': 2019, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1483951121}
review:
Anomaly Defenders is a fine and very pretty tower defense game that at best gets quite hectic as waves roll in. There are enough active elements to keep one alert and all around everything is just very competent.

I will say though Anomaly Defenders is not comparable at all with the previous entries in the series. There is barely any story here and all around the whole thing is a massive downgrade from Anomaly 2. Now that is fine and all but as a "closing installment of the Anomaly series" as the storepage says Defenders is an absolute disgrace(to be dramatic about it).

So as long as one doesn¬¥t go in looking for Anomaly 3 everything is fine and dandy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040859758', 'num_games_owned': 1741, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1386, 'last_played': 1469037393}
review:
[b] Anomaly : Warzone Earth	[/b] √©tait sorti √† une p√©riode o√π le [i]Tower Defense[/i] √©tait tr√®s en vogue et qui fonctionnait sur une base immuable : le joueur prot√®ge sa base en achetant et disposant des tourelles avec des pouvoirs sp√©cifiques  qui vont ensuite subir l‚Äôassaut de vague successives d‚Äôennemis. Sauf qu‚Äôici, les gars de 11bit Studios (ceux-l√† m√™me qui bien plus proche d‚Äôaujourd‚Äôhui nous offrirons This War Of Mine) ont d√©cid√© de proposer un [i]Tower Defense[/i] en inversant la recette en pla√ßant le joueur du c√¥t√© de la vague d‚Äôassaillants qui doit survivre aux tours de d√©fense. Ainsi le [i]Tower Offense[/i] √©tait n√©. 

[h1] No Offense bro [/h1]

Principe absolument g√©nial qui verra deux suites : Anomaly Korea et Anomaly 2 chacun apportant son lot de nouveaut√© mais restant dans le m√™me genre que leur ain√©. Le genre se pr√™tant d√©licieusement √† l‚Äôinterface tactile, il est un de mes meilleurs souvenirs de jeu tablette et mobile. 

Un peu comme pour en finir avec le cycle des Anomaly, 11bit a d√©cid√© de faire cette fois jouer le r√¥le de l‚Äôenvahisseur envahi (les humains passant √† l‚Äôoffensive allant jusqu‚Äô√† la plan√®te d‚Äôorigine des assaillants des premiers jeux). R√©sultat, on se retrouve dans le r√¥le du Tower Defense (on renverse la recette invers√©e). L√† o√π auparavant nous devions faire avancer une escouade d‚Äôun point A au point B, nous nous retrouvons aujourd‚Äôhui dans le r√¥le d‚Äôun [i]Tower Defense[/i] des plus classiques. 
Alors bien entendu, on peut s‚Äôattendre √† √™tre quelque peu d√©√ßu du fait de revenir au classique du genre sans rien apporter de nouveau mais le plaisir prend (peut-√™tre gr√¢ce √† l‚Äôambiance et l‚Äôunivers install√© par les Anomaly au fil du temps). 

Le jeu est assez court. 24 missions chacun en 3 difficult√©s (easy/normal/hard) et peut se finir rapidement si vous d√©cidez, par exemple, de le finir en un seul mode de jeu. En terminant une mission, vous vous verrez attribuez des points de technologie que vous pourrez d√©penser dans un arbre technologique (logique). C‚Äôest tout b√™te mais plus vous avancerez et plus vous aurez envie d‚Äôavoir de ces points et m√™me tr√®s vite les r√©attribuer afin de ‚Äòmieux passer‚Äô un niveau et ainsi engranger encore plus de points. Les technologies d√©bloquent divers bonus et capacit√©s pour vos tours de d√©fense. 
Bien entendu, chaque tour √† ses caract√©ristiques, en attaque ou en d√©fense, et sera plus ou moins capable en fonction de l‚Äôennemi rencontr√© (ou plut√¥t, devrait-on dire en fonction de la composition des vagues ennemies rencontr√©es). 

Comme sur les anciens Anomaly, vous pourrez disposer de comp√©tences sp√©ciales utilisables sur vos tours (comme le bouclier, sniper qui augmente la port√©e, r√©paration, la rage, etc). Des comp√©tences qui se retrouvent justement dans l‚Äôarbre technologique o√π vous pourrez les d√©bloquer en fonction du nombre de point de technologique poss√©d√©. Ces capacit√©s seront utilisables en mission en fonction du caucarusium que vous r√©coltez soit avec une tour de r√©colte sur un emplacement sp√©cifique ou en fonction du nombre d‚Äôennemi tu√©. C‚Äôest la ressource alien du jeu, notre ressource. Et en tuant vos ennemis, vous cumulez aussi de l‚Äô√©nergie (qui remplace les $Dollars$ des anciens Anomaly) qui seront n√©cessaires pour placer vos tours, les upgrader et finir la mission avec le meilleur score possible. D‚Äôailleurs, l‚Äôensemble des valeurs comme la difficult√©, l‚Äô√©nergie amass√©e et le nombre d‚Äôunit√© perdue, d√©termineront le nombre de point technologique d√©bloqu√©.  

Esth√©tiquement r√©ussi, l‚Äôhabillage du jeu reste dans la trempe des premiers, au top. La musique vous plonge dans l‚Äôambiance pendant que les effets visuels, sans trop en faire, vous plonge un peu plus dans l'univers [i]spatiale[/i] du jeu. Cependant, au fil des missions, on peut regretter le manque de vari√©t√© des d√©cors. 


Anomaly Defenders est un bon Tower Defense pour d√©butants et les plus courageux pourront s‚Äôatteler ais√©ment √† la compl√©tion du jeu (la chose √©tant largement accessible sans y passer trop de temps). 

On a rarement ce jeu en bundle ou en promo. Un bon petit jeu qui peut-√™tre ne vaut pas le prix demand√© (10‚Ç¨) mais √† prendre sans souci en promo pour qui veut s'y essayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068978551', 'num_games_owned': 2036, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1468079052}
review:
Pros
+ Pace of the game is very natural -- you feel like you are making progress without grinding.  (You can buy something from the research tree after every level).
+ The setting of the game and graphics are very cool looking.  There are several different locations; I only wish that they used the ones with a bit of nature more often.
+ Tower special-abiity system (see below)
+ Upgrade tree is freely refundable -- you can try out different tactics.
+ Map scrolling is fluid, and clicking on enemy arrows will zoom you to a danger zone.
+ Different difficulties of each map have slightly diffferent tower placment locations, making them more interesting than a simple ramp-up in enemies.
+ Nice boost tower type -- allows you to choose +range, +tower heal, or +DPS, and switch between them within a map.
+ Female voiceovers are pleasant, and not annoying.
+ Music is appropriate and exciting to the game.

Cons
- Enemy Units are difficult to distinguish one type from another.
- Towers are similarly unidentifiable.
- No hotkeys, but mouse control is pretty fast.
- One annoying achievement to play all difficulties of all levels... yes, even if you beat a level on Hard, you have to go and play it on Normal and Easy modes.

Overall, even though it is a "standard" tower defense game, I enjoyed playing.  The units' and towers' unidentifiability comes from similar models, outlines around the units, and general chaos of firing effects.  Luckily, this game is much more on the casual side, so it really isn't that critical.

The tower special-ability system is something pretty unique -- each tower can use 6 different abilities, ranging from healing itself (and others), to increased range, dps, and even blowing itself up!  This adds a feeling of control & power when you know you can boost a tower when an elite unit (boss) is in range.

Recommended.

review:
Analizando Anomaly Defenders

Este an√°lisis lo realizo informando de que soy un jugador casual de juegos de estrategia, as√≠ mismo me baso en la campa√±a y en la dificultad f√°cil y medio. En general me mantuvo entretenido un rato, sobre la dificultad lo empec√© en medio pero despu√©s de 15 o 16 mundos lo cambien a f√°cil ya que no me quer√≠a esforzar demasiado. 

Jugabilidad
Sobre las unidades puedo decir que se siente bien ser el lado al√≠en (malo seg√∫n el punto de vista), pero un poca escasa la variedad. La rama de tecnolog√≠a le da un poco m√°s de emoci√≥n pero despu√©s de la mitad de la campa√±a te das cuenta que la mitad no sirve de mucho.

M√∫sica
Ser√© breve, corta y m√°s o menos emocionante sin destacar mucho.

Gr√°ficos
Sin pena ni gloria bas√°ndose en un juego anterior para de celular no esperaba unas graficas de juegos triple A.

En general lo recomiendo para gente que gusta del g√©nero y el juego original ya que esto queda como una continuaci√≥n (lo intu√≠ por la leyenda de ‚Äúmismo conflicto‚Äù de la portada del juego). No le veo mucha rejugabilidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981638563', 'num_games_owned': 4007, 'num_reviews': 517, 'playtime_forever': 1330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1209, 'last_played': 1463072087}
review:
[b]Anomaly: Warzone Earth[/b] was heavily praised by both gamers and press. The reason for that was the fact that it was so-called ‚Äúreverse tower defense‚Äù game, where we used to control the offensive forces and lead them through enemy defense lines. There was certainly something in the idea of finding the right route for your troops, while graphics were pretty stylish, so, the game quickly became a huge success. And since it was the [b]11 bit studios[/b]' first big game, they quickly decided that they're special. And that's what led them to this, [b]Anomaly Defenders[/b] game.

The idea behind this one is that players are now controlling aliens instead of humans. Sounds cool, I like changes, but that's actually the biggest problem. The thing is - [b]Anomaly Defenders[/b] isn't our usual [b]Anomaly[/b] game anymore. Instead, it's a typical tower defense game. Simple and generic as all others. And since it was released in [b]2014[/b], I must say that it was [i]extremely[/i] stupid thing to do. I mean, in [b]2014[/b] the market was already overloaded by defense games. Up to the point, where people started to despise them like all those infinite hidden objects games. There was just no place for another generic tower defense. Games like [b]Sang-Froid: Tales of Werewolves[/b] tried to achieve the success by being a bit different. [b]11 bit studios[/b] decided that they're cool and famous now and can sell things just because [b]Anomaly[/b] name became well-known. And failed. Hard.

[b]Anomaly Defenders[/b] isn't really bad. Graphics are nice for tower defense game, and it plays pretty well, but the problem is ‚Äì there's nothing in it. No commander, no tactical map, no even interesting missions like that bridges mission from the original game. It's just a tower defense. Simple and boring. You place towers, you upgrade them, you unlock the new towers and some extra abilities like shields and long range shots between the missions, and that's it. There's nothing more. [b]23[/b] of [b]24[/b] missions in the game (this game is longer than any previous [b]Anomaly[/b] games) feel exactly the same. It's just you, some towers and pretty small maps. Only the final mission feels somewhat interesting. If every mission was as interesting as the final one, the game would have a chance. As is ‚Äì no. Especially since it isn't even especially well-polished. New [b]UI[/b], for example, looks cool, but feels terrible and you'll often need to pause the game just because the [b]UI[/b] isn't good enough. There's also no gamepad support. At all.

So, nah. [b]Anomaly Defenders[/b] totally doesn't deserve any attention. [b]2014[/b] was a year, where there were so many tower defense games already that some developers even started to make fun from it. Like [b]Awesome Games Studio[/b] called their game [b]Yet Another Zombie Defense[/b]. [b]11 bit studios[/b] actually can call [b]Anomaly Defenders[/b] ‚Äú[b]Yet Another Alien Defense[/b]‚Äù, because that's exactly what it is. Yet another defense game. Boring and repetitive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001335383', 'num_games_owned': 1726, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1457873159}
review:
The "Anomaly" series is a truly unique series if you analyze it from a tower defense perspective simply because it puts the player in the position of the attacker, not the defender. Anomaly Defenders however is a return to the classic tower defense genre and it's not surprisingly at all judging by the way the story evolved in the previous games. 

Unfortunately, it has nothing to the tower defense genre and moreover, it has some issues that stopped me from loving this game, no matter how much I struggled to do so. 

From a technical standpoint, the game is flawless. The game looks great yet runs smoothly even on older hardware and I was unable to find any bugs (not that I actually looked). 

The gameplay however is where it fails, more or less. The best thing about this is the technology tree. This one is actually well made, easy to understand even for less experienced gamers and offers some interesting features and upgrades. 

From here on, things go down. 

The game features 24 maps and 3 difficulty levels for each map, each level rewarding the player with a certain amount of technology points. About half of the maps are very well designed and offer some tactical variations and different approaches while the other maps seem chaotic, leaving no chance for tactics and reducing the gameplay to a state of pure brute force with a trial and error approach. 

The towers, while the same towers from the rest of the games, now seem very underpowered and, with a few exception, there is not much difference in what damage they can take and make. 

The ability wheel, that allows you to build, sell or upgrade towers as well as access the abilities seems and can be quite unintuitive when being used in large battles. You can often find yourself selling your tower instead of upgrading it or buying a different tower than the one needed because of the small am very similar tower icons.

On the other hand, the enemy units, mostly the ones from the other Anomaly games, can seem very overpowered quite often. 

The enemy units are very slow paced when they enter the map but change instantly when they are close to the towers, forcing the player to pause the game to repair/upgrade or use other abilities. 

Combining these with the poorly designed maps, you will often find yourself having to choose between towers that prevent the ground units from advancing and those that will prevent the air support units from wracking your towers and base. 

And as if this wasn't enough, some maps have "random" hazards/treats, like meteorites falling from the sky that will destroy the towers if not repaired on time or lighting strikes that will disable EXACTLY the towers that are firing the advancing enemy units. So much for the random element. 

The game is mostly incredibly easy but some maps that combine all the elements mentioned above, can be ridiculously hard. 

In terms of story and atmosphere the game simply fails, especially if compared to the other Anomaly games. 

Overall, the game was a disappointment and far from what I would expect from an Anomaly game or even a tower defense game. 

Again, it would be nice if Steam would have a "MEH" option for reviews. This is one of those games that I cannot down vote but I shouldn't upvote as well. You could give it a try if you have the chance to get it on a sale but don't expect much from it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076251308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1552620835}
review:
Worked fine on my old system, but new one, game fires up, can start first mission, but it eventually will 'force close' with no error (Game just blinks away) by the time the 2nd wave starts(Very first mission)

I feel its related, but don't really care to check into it, to the VERY first time I attempted to run it, and it was detected as a Trojan by my AV (But once I made exception it would start normally...that is until I attempt to play that first mission)

Oh well, I liked it when it worked, but it don't want to play nice now.

I DO recommend it as a game, but its risky, chances are if it don't work your screwed (I have had no responses from steam about this, decided to write up this instead)

author: {'steamid': '76561198053070206', 'num_games_owned': 9982, 'num_reviews': 267, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1561716823}
review:
Anomaly has always been a reverse Tower Defense game but not for this one.
In this game you're playing Tower Defense and have a role as the Anomaly (read: alien) Commander.
Your mission is to fend of the human attacker and stay alive.

11 bit studios still got their beatiful graphics and sounds.
As I expected, this one turns out as a great challenging Tower Defense game.
But yeah for this series it lacks story. Unlike the other Anomaly game, Anomaly Defenders didn't have a strong storyline.
Overall, this is a must pick for Anomaly fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978119745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1449581106}
review:
I really enjoyed the orginal set of Anomaly games both on PC and on Mobile.  Great graphics, story was OK and it turned tower defence on its head.  I played them all almost addictively and was dissapointed when I was done.

So I had high hopes for Anomaly Defenders, well, what a disappointment!

The best I can say is 'Meh'  it just doesn't hold my attention.  Theres virtually no strategy involved, just build towers and upgrade them as quick as you can and you'll beat the level, that is until your technology level is no longer high enough, and you get totally anihilated. you then have to go back and repeatedly re-do levels at higher difficulties just to get more technology points to spend on upgrades.

Story is non-existent (I know the other anomaly games weren't exactly stellar, but at least you felt like you were progressing through something)

I really struggle to believe that these are the same developers that produced Anomaly :-(

author: {'steamid': '76561198038597623', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1447438460}
review:
Anomaly Warzone Earth garnered a deserved success in reversing the classic Tower Defense formula to make a refreshing Tower Attack. After several iterations the designers attempted to invert their original idea. Unfortunately most innovative features of its predecessors get lost in the process and the final result Anomaly Defender is just an insipid sub-par Tower Defense. The main issues being a dull gameplay and the lack of challenge.

+ The game use the Unreal engine, and like the other Anomaly games it is technically well made with neat graphics.

+ The technology tree is well made and offer decent choices.

- The biggest flaw of the game is the poor gameplay, there are two part to this:

First, on the strategic level there is not much decisions to make and creative ways to place your towers. You can only build towers on specific locations outside of the enemy path, which means no ‚Äúmazing‚Äù option. Then the choices are pretty obvious, place your long range towers in the back row, and your more resilient close range tower closer to the enemy paths. In contrast one of the best thing in the previous Tower Attack games was the ability to plan, and change on the fly, your attack route, giving you the ability to approach strong positions from a favorable angle.

Secondly, during the action proper, the enemy advance at a slow pace, but when they come in the vicinity of your towers most of the action consist of pausing the game to activate your towers special powers. The maps design makes it worse as many times enemy waves attack from different directions, often outside of the screen view. This lead to even greater micromanagement, the scrolling speed being too slow, yo have to pause the game constantly to activate and repair your towers in various parts of the map. Overall it kills the real time feeling associated with tower defense, of seeing the enemy trying to overwhelm your base.

To ‚Äúspice‚Äù things up there are random hazards in some levels, like meteorites falling down damaging both your towers and the enemy. In practice I found it was just a terrible, and unsuccessfull attempt to add something to the poor gameplay.

There is more or less a story in the campaign, but it is completely forgettable, and in contrast to the previous game in the series where action was tense and atmospheric, voice acting and special events don't add anything in this one.


- To make thing even less interesting the game offer little challenge:

There are 24 maps in the game. It starts with easy tutorial like maps, but actually half of the maps are very basic and uninspired. Few are challenging and in most case the enemy never came close to even scratch my base. In the end only the very last level on hard difficulty was a real challenge who required several attempts, a carefully thought out plan and proper combination of various type of towers and powers. Most other times the first and obvious towers placement was good enough.

The game has 3 difficulty levels, the problem is the way you earn the Tech Points so critical to unlock the better towers and special powers. Completing a level on easy/normal/ hard give you around 6/8/9 Tech Pts respectively (more pts on the later level but the proportions are the same). The game is not really hard and I make my first play-through on normal. However I could have played all levels on easy first to gather plenty Tech Pts and to make my attempts on normal so much easier. Somehow giving so much points for the easy levels ruin the gameplay. I strongly encourage you to play on normal first, and move back and play previous levels on hard if you really need extra Tech Pts.

In the end the game was just a disappointment. It is vastly inferior to the previous Anomaly games, and fail even on the basics of Tower Defense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031180632', 'num_games_owned': 593, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1446677884}

Wie bei vielen hektischen TD-Spielen ist es auch hier wichtig √∂fters auf einzelne T√ºrme zuzugreifen um Spezialf√§higkeiten (Reparatur, Schild, Rage etc) zu aktivieren. Der gro√üe Unterschied von Anomaly Defenders zu den meisten hektischen TDs besteht nun darin, da√ü dies alles w√§hrend einer Pausierung des Spiels erledigt werden kann.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983500496', 'num_games_owned': 643, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1446577924}
review:
Am jucat toate celelalte jocuri din serie si pot sa spun ca acesta este cel mai slab. Daca sunteti fani si vreti sa vedeti cum e si de cealalta parte a baricadei il puteti juca, daca reusiti sa il luati la un pret mai mic fata de Steam.


Pentru prima oarƒÉ (fƒÉc√¢nd excep»õie modul online din Anomaly 2) vom putea controla turnurile, ma»ôinƒÉriile anomaliei. Povestea jocului este destul de slabƒÉ spre lipsƒÉ »ôi se bazeazƒÉ pe ideea cƒÉ a»õi fƒÉcut alegerea albastrƒÉ din jocul precedent Anomaly 2. DacƒÉ a»õi fƒÉcut-o pe cealaltƒÉ nu conteazƒÉ, jocul continuƒÉ principiul distrugerii cristalelor albastre »ôi prezervarea anomaliei.



Astfel vƒÉz√¢nd cƒÉ nu e»ôti o simplƒÉ ma»ôinƒÉ de ucis care ascultƒÉ numai de cei de rank superior, ma»ôinƒÉrile te cheamƒÉ sƒÉ lup»õi √Æmpotriva omenirii care le amenin»õƒÉ planeta. Comunicarea cu ma»ôinƒÉriile s-a fƒÉcut foarte pu»õin √Æn precedentul episod dar foarte vag. De ce esti chemat sa lupti chiar impotriva omenirii este incert dar inafara de aceasta premisa a jocului, Anomaly Defenders nu mai are nici o poveste clara. (Nu am terminat inca jocul insa pana in acest moment nu am mai vazut nimic legat de poveste)


In joc va trebui sa finalizezi diferite nivele cu diferite decoruri care vor defeni destul de plictisitoare de la inceput. Practic oameniii cu trupele pe care deja le cunoastem dar cu un nou nume vor veni sa distruga capsulele ce tin embrionii locuitorilor de pe planeta. Tu va trebui sa opresti atacul inamicilor montand turnuri de aparare situationale, adica in functie de cine te ataca si unde va trebui sa alegi cu ce turnuri sa ii contracarezi.


Toate turnurile ce au fost prezente in celelalte jocuri vor fi acum de partea ta, iar in timp in functie de dificultate vei colectiona puncte (Tech Points) pentru a debloca puteri si modificari pentru turn.


Cele 2 resurse pe care le vei folosi vor fi Carusarum si Energy Points. Carusarum iti va permite sa construiesti turnurile iar punctele energie pe care le iei de la inamici infranti te vor ajuta sa folosesti abilitatile. Fiecare abiltiate are un numar clar de puncte de energie pe care le foloseste si va trebui sa alegi ce turnuri sa construiesti, imbunatatesti.


Treptat lupta va fi mai grea, si precum celealte jocuri vei avea diferite strategii ce te vor putea ajuta, ba pe redirectarea traseului prin plasarea turnurilro harvest, ce colecteaza resurse din diferite campuri sau plasarea turnurilor in spatele mediului pentru a putea fi pazite de raza vizuala a inamicilor.


Pana in acest moment nu am vazut inamici condusi de un Commander.


Daca celelalte jocuri ar fi fost demne si pentru PC atunci Anomaly Defenders nu pare nimic mai mult decat o portare de pe sistemele mobile. Interfata, modul de joc si cam tot arata ca a fost facut mai mult pentru astfel de dispozitive.


[h1]Ca o concluzie[/h1]
Este un joc ce pare lipsit de substanta, iar singurul lucru care ii da continuitate este sistemul de upgrade (tech points) si prin introducerea graduala a inamicilor mai dificili si variati.


Nivelele nu au niciodata legatura intre ele si te simti ca si cum ai fi terminat un nivel generat aleator.

Daca in precedentele jocuri, incepeai de la 0, povestea si modul de expunere te faceau sa simti ca mereu ajungi intr-o locatie noua si o noua provocare te a»ôteaptƒÉ. Din nefericire Anomaly Defenders are o poveste din start foarte ciudata, neverosimila, iar gameplayul pe cat de unic (controland turnurile) isi pierde puterea de a captiva din primele momente.


Anomaly Defenders nu este un joc suficient de bun pentru a sta singur in fata altora din genul Tower Defense si nu reprezinta o incercare de intinerire a seriei ci mai mult un raspuns al cererii fanilor de a putea juca ca turnurile.


Anomaly Defenders este un joc care pare obligatoriu pentru toti cei ce detin seria, iar aici va las pe voi sa decideti daca chiar asa este, insa pe mine, in afara de senzatia initiala, jocul nu a reu»ôit sƒÉ mƒÉ captiveze. DacƒÉ tot vre»õi sƒÉ √Æl lua»õi, cumpƒÉra»õi-l c√¢nd atinge maxim 4euro.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971411597', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1426085073}
review:
Compared to existing Tower Defense games, Anomaly Defenders is a decent one. 

The game twists the original storyline by placing you, the commander, at the side of the machines, as you plan a counterattack against your own kind, humanity, which now can strike the final and fatal blow. Your job is to prevent the 24 launchpads to be destroyed in order to send remaining aliens into space. All of this without any second thoughts, simply to ensure the survival of the machines. How kind of you.

The game features a bunch of good and proven ideas, with a nice execution. Towers comes from the Anomaly Warzone serie - so you kinda feel at home - and are accessible via a Tech Tree, from which you can buy or resell technologies if you need; along with abilities and improvements (armor, critical damage, energy pool, buying and selling cost). 

Caurasaurum is the ingame currency used to buy towers, and Energy can be grabbed on destroyed enemy units to activate special abilities like Repair, Shield, Rage, Sniper...

Like many Tower Defense games, each level is a combination of a tutorial and a puzzle. The game in some extent tries to push you from your comfort zone each time you have found an optimal placement for a tower, or a deadly combination of towers. But anyhow, Anomaly Defender can be reduced to a puzzle even if there is some tension in selecting the right place for towers since they occupy more or less space.

The strange thing about Anomaly Warzone is that, in spite of its qualities, the gameplay becomes sometimes repetitive, the most intense moment being the beginning of each level where you analyse and plan your towers placement, then simply repair and upgrade them as the human forces grow stronger. 

There is really a radical loss of pacing compared the Warzone serie, in which you have to constantly re-route your squad, run for energy ressources or carefully place abilities like Repair.

This might be an example of the difference between a game like Anomaly Warzone with a novel and solid core concept that can sustain even a barely good execution ; and a game like Anomaly Defenders who spawns inside an established genre, without an outstanding concept, but with proven ideas and a good execution.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993309139', 'num_games_owned': 1059, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2015, 'last_played': 1421373188}
review: The original Anomaly was an interesting take on tower defense for me because it had me filling the shoes of the attackers and planning the best route to reach the goal.  Defenders is more traditional tower defense game which I found less appealing but it was a nice enough distraction.  My major criticism is that it becomes very easy to break the game with the right upgrades.  The game does as some map specific effects that might make you change your strategy, but for the most part once you find something that works you can ride it to victory (although it is nice to have so many upgrade options to fit different play styles).  There really isn‚Äôt much of a story but that didn‚Äôt bother me for this type of game.  Overall I enjoyed the time I spent playing the game but I would have no reason ever to revisit it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981203183', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1423811639}
review: I have always enjoyed all the Anomaly games and this final title of the franchise goes back to the original TD formula. This time you command the aliens instead of the humans. I would probably consider the Defense Grid series the better TD games but AD would probably come second, it still requires the same micromanagement like their past titles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091685831', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1585951541}
review: If you play any previous games of Anomaly, then I only need to say that this game put you in opposite situation. Anomaly Defenders is a tower defense game where you build and control  towers and kill enemy squads. As in previous games you have special abilities which improves your towers and you also have a technology where you upgrade your towers. Game has 24 missions and 3 difficulty levels.  Graphics is nice and can be played on an average pc or notebook. There is also a mobile version of this game which offers the same as PC version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058356169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 723, 'last_played': 1422767003}
review:
I purchased this game during a dry period in strategy gaming, knowing nothing about it really except that it had decent reviews. I later discovered that its part of the Anomaly series (the Tower Offense series ... which I hadn't played, so that never really came to mind for me). So I found myself jumping into an established universe knowing nothing about it. However, it doesn't seem all that deep... and so it wasn't hard to catch up. I will probably go back and purchase the other Anomaly games now, so: this game was good enough to widen their audience. If you want to know the details, read on!

GOOD
- Graphics are very pretty

- Game is quite fun

- The pause mode is great. Takes the twitch gaming out, in favor of tactics and strategy (as a strategy game ought to)

- The background artwork on the levels (there tends to be stuff behind the main game map) is interesting and inventive. Very artistic, and often animated, doing interesting things. It doesn't distract from the game, but sometimes I'd start a level and just look around at the background before starting the mission. Very pretty!

- Music and sound : epic soundtrack with an interesting voice actor as the AI companion, and the battle sounds seemed reasonable for what they're associated with.


BAD
- Towers are repetitive without much to differentiate them. Its not easy to tell their purpose. Form should follow function, but clearly the designers wanted an alien organic machine look. They got that, but at the expense of practicality and interesting tower design

- There is still a twitch gaming element, in that I found myself constantly casting spells, which was annoying and repetitive

- For a strategy game, there's not a lot of strategy. Pretty-much the same strategies work all the time, and can be reused endlessly with little variation. The enemy is very dumb, and I was able to complete almost every level with 0 damage to the base the first time through on normal mode... that doesn't bode well for strategy games. Strategy where you don't really have to think isn't really strategy. I will add that there were a few times where you need to switch strategy up: such as the introduction of aircraft, shock units (etc), but there are really only 6 of these moments in 24 missions. And after you adapt to the new circumstances, you can just go back to grinding away, now with the new strategy.

- No real story. There is a hint at something deeper, but for the most part its just "kill waves of enemies so I can launch the next escape pod."

- Controls can be a bit wonky. I am not sure if this was made as a mobile port or what, but click-drag is the only realistic means to get around the map. The arrow keys pan... very very slowly. And moving the mouse cursor to the edges like in most RTS games is EVEN SLOWER.

- Non-remappable keys ... you'd think in 2015 all games would have remappable controls, but apparently Anomaly Defenders is stuck back in the 90s or so. This is annoying because ... arrow keys for panning? Once again: not the 90's anymore. Use WASD, or at least make it so we can set it to WASD. Secondly: Shift calls the next wave. Better hope you don't get a steam message, because if you Shift+Tab, you might find yourself knee deep in bad-guys. Once again: it would be fine if there were a way to set it to another keymap.

- Enemies are boring : waves of mechs, bomb mechs, fire mechs, different sized mechs, tanks, tanks with turrets, tanks without turrets, tanks with 2 guns on their turret.... (I think you get the idea). For the most part, the enemies seemed uninspired. None were particularly memorable aside from the spider mech and the aircraft, which were pretty cool. 

- The meteor level is annoying. Defending a base where random meteors hit doesn't really add that much to a level except annoyance and frustration. If you're going to kill my towers, I prefer that they are destroyed by skill and not some random dice roll. Thankfully this only happened in one level, and the level is otherwise pretty easy.


CONCLUSION
Not bad as a Tower Defense game. Much too easy, with some annoying levels, boring enemies, and some control problems - but otherwise quite good. Its carried especially on the merits of its very pretty explosions and gorgeous backdrops, and the fact that its just very solid gameplay in-general. But then again... tower defense is hard to mess up. Anyway, its fun if you're looking to kill some time. Not really a challenge, but lots of stuff explodes. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198022266051', 'num_games_owned': 3249, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1422154381}
review:
[h1]One of these is not like the others....[/h1]

The Anomaly series was unique in that it was Tower [i]Offense[/i], the player invading on a map of statically placed towers.  Anomaly Defenders completely abandoned that and made a simple Tower Defense game.  This completely and totally destroys the story, and made it hard for me to even care about what happened.   The player is to now defend the aliens, who originally invaded earth killing millions of people, by now destroying the humans who are now here to wipe the aliens out...uh...ok.

Story aside, there are some PROs.

[h1]The Good:[/h1]
[b]+ Graphics.[/b]  The graphics that are in the game are pretty good.

[b]+ Level Design.[/b]  Overall, this was good as some levels were nicely laid out allowing for different strategies.

[b]+ Polished.[/b]  Overall this is a pretty well-done and polished game.

[h1]The Eh:[/h1]
[b]~ Graphic Style.[/b]  Eh, I would have preferred a more realistic / natural style similar to the previous Anomaly games which are also, and most importantly, ON LAND as that would be a better and more natural place for an invading army.  Instead the invasion is on some sort of orbital space station?  Every time?  And with tanks?  Uh, ok...

[b]~ Audio.[/b]  Voice-overs and audio are both OK.

[b]~ Pause Button.[/b]  Having a Pause button available which only pauses one-party, allowing the player to continue to issue commands, seems like built-in cheating.  Makes me feel that they did this because they didn't implement check-points.

[h1]The Bad:[/h1]
[b]- Story.[/b]  I'm playing to destroy humans...<shakes head>

[b]- Limited tower placements.[/b]  Particularly for Scorchers that only fire straight-ahead.  Many times there's a pad just HALF a path off center, now completely useless as a pad for a Scorcher.  In fact, there are only a few placements that a Scorcher can be reasonably placed.

[b]- No Checkpoints.[/b]  If for whatever reason you need to start over, you're starting the entire level over.

[b]- Randomness in some levels.[/b]  The constant rain of meteors on one level, or lightning strikes disabling towers.  Ugh.

Anomaly Defenders gives you [b]24 missions in the Campaign[/b], and I didn't see much re-play other than playing the same levels again in the 3 levels of difficulty.  The campaign took me [b]6.9 hours to complete[/b].

[h1]If you want a good Tower Defense game, go check out [u]Defense Grid[/u].  Anomaly Defenders is if you really like the Anomaly series and just want more (even if it is Defense instead of Offense).

6 out of 10.[/h1]

[i]It's "Recommended" for those who like the Anomaly series as the game is fairly polished and well-done.  However, if you're unfamiliar with the Anomaly series and just like Tower Defense games, I'd look elsewhere.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198082571983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1421714553}
review:
[h1]A very decent TD[/h1]

Anomaly Defenders is not a great game but was very fun to play. The mechanics are easy to understand. On easy mode this game is... well, easy, but still fun. Would recommend if it is on sale and you enjoy a casual tower defense game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082696800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1407329713}
review:
Firstly, I would like to mention that I personally enjoy the Anomaly Series, however I would not recommend this game to my friends. Anomaly Defenders is a Tower Defence game, instead of the well-renowned Tower Offense games. This is contrary to the thing that makes the Anomaly Franchise stand out of other games. The Anomaly Franchise is famous for its Tower Offense games and I felt that Anomaly Defenders ruined it, therefore I would not recommend you getting this game. 

If you are new to the Anomaly Series and you are interested in getting this game, try Anomaly: Warzone Earth or Anomaly 2 instead as I do feel that the gameplay in those games are more enjoyable, especially when the Anomaly Franchise is well known for its Tower Offense. If you are interested in a Tower Defence game, don‚Äôt waste your money on this game and I would suggest you getting Sanctum 2 instead. If you had played the other games from the Anomaly Series and you are interested in getting this game, do not bother getting this game too, unless you are a hard-core fan of the Anomaly Franchise and have extra cash to spend on.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995498126', 'num_games_owned': 2373, 'num_reviews': 668, 'playtime_forever': 2003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1970, 'last_played': 1419860632}
review:
WOW! A very nice TD game!

Ein richtig gutes Tower Defense Spiel!

Mir hat der erste Teil der Serie gar nicht so gut gefallen, wo man selbst mit ein paar Panzern durch die Verteidigung der Aliens hindurchgelangen muss. So etwas liegt mir einfach nicht, ich bin mehr der defensiv agierende Typ, auch in klassischen Echtzeitstrategiespielen.

Daher dachte ich auch erst, das hier m√ºsste man ja nicht unbedingt spielen, aber weit gefehlt! Es ist richtig spannend und macht auch irgendwie spieles√ºchtig, um alle Herausforderungen und Schwierigkeitsstufen zu meistern.
Wer schon Spiele wie Defense Grid mochte, f√ºr den ist das hier auch ein absoluter Pflichtkauf!

+ ansprechende Grafik, toll designte Landschaften
+ Mapvielfalt und Gestaltung (24 Karten, 3 Schwierigkeitsgrade, jedes Mal etwas andere Levelgestaltung und Gegneraufkommen)
+ umfangreicher Techbaum, dessen Verbesserungen man mit freigespielten Belohnungen erkauft
+ eine gute Balance bei Anzahl und Unterschiede der T√ºrme und gegnerischen Einheiten
+ Sound und Musik haben mir gut gefallen
+ Preis, sehr g√ºnstig f√ºr das Gebotene
+ Steam Herausforderungen sind alle durchaus machbar, 2-3 ben√∂tigen etwas mehr Zeit bzw. k√∂nnen schwer zu holen sein
+ Online Rangliste, auch nur mit Freunden vergleichbar

o nur deutsche Texte, englische Sprachausgabe, ist aber ok 
o keine Zwischensequenzen oder √§hnliches, quasi nur die n√§chste Karte und <hopp> los gehts, ist aber leider bei vielen TD Games so, daher kann man dr√ºberwegsehen
o Missionsauswahl ist sehr einfach gehalten, man sieht nur den Missionstext, aber keine Kartenvorschau, das nervt evtl. bei der Suche nach einer speziellen Karte

- mir ist nichts besonders negativ aufgefallen :-)

Fazit:
Da das Spiel so ziemlich alles richtig gemacht hat und Kleinigkeiten verziehen werden k√∂nnen, darf man ruhig 8/10 Punkte vergeben. Das Spiel bietet jetzt zwar in keiner Sache ein besonderes Alleinstellungsmerkmal, vereint aber viele positive Elemente anderer erfolgreicher Spiele. Nichts wirkt aufgesetzt, alles hat seinen Sinn. Sch√∂n ist vor allem die Tatsache, dass bei den 3 Schwierigkeitsgraden die Levelgestaltung jedes mal ein wenig ge√§ndert wird und die Gegner anders zusammengesetzt sind. So hat man sehr lange was vom Spiel, ohen dass einem sofort langweilig wird, nur weil man alles schaffen m√∂chte. Der Preis ist zudem sehr g√ºnstig.

Also: KAUFEN!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970329288', 'num_games_owned': 2788, 'num_reviews': 1451, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1416038067}
review:
From the creators that brought us the superb tower defense game: 'Anomaly' comes the last game planned in the series.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=shUKQC1JTFY
The original incarnation of the Tower Offense sub-genre had players controlling humans fighting alien invaders. Now, the tables have turned. The human counterattack is underway and the alien homeworld is under threat. Defend the planet from the human scum in the final battle of the series. Anomaly Defenders is a fast-paced Tower Defense game where attacking human troops can damage and destroy your defenses. You have to react and counterattack enemies on the battlefield at all times. Each time you start a campaign, the unique tech-tree technologies can be tailored to your needs. Killing humans is easier due to 8 upgradable towers and special functions: repair your towers, make them go berserk, sacrifice them in explosions that are harmful to nasty humans, and use other tricks. This is the final battle against the humans. - Highly Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978246593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 874, 'last_played': 1413673510}
review:
I had a reasonably good time playing this game. It doesn't seem to have much variety and has the standard rock-paper-shotgun formula with the towers. To start off there are some negative points I would like to point out. The towers lack proper descriptions and the interface is somewhat disgraceful. I never used any hotkeys because I don't think this game really has any. There is no information regarding towers and it took me longer than I would like to admit to notice that the health/damage/range of towers is displayed at the top of the screen. I guess my screen is so big that a few words at the top don't really grab my attention. As for the rest of it, the enemy damage is very very managable until a point. Some enemy units just pulverize your cannons and there is so little you can do about it. The enemy has disruption which prevents cannons from shooting and some of the missions do as well. I think there are 4/25 missions that have interference from the environment and they can be frustrating as they can be very random. Lightening missions cause towers to stop working and some missions have debris falling on your head which is very very random. I have had it on hard mode and cleared without an issue and then go on easy and just can't keep my turrets up because debris just won't stop landing on them.

That said, the game itself is rather entertaining. I don't think it has much replay value but if you are looking for a good 10 minute tower defense game, just take a map and go for it. It had some novel concepts in it, like towers can only be placed in certain places etc. which give it more of a challenge which both annoyed me but made it unique and fun. I would definately recommend this game to people who enjoy a good tower defense game. It won't be so hard that you rip your hair out but it isn't so easy (well, it can be) that you can afk out and survive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013876170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 280, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1412625891}
review:
This is like Space Run, except here the intensity of combat is a bit less intensive than what you would find in Space Run. They play differently no doubt and it is more akin to Defense Grid but with offensive enemies that will attack your base. On easy mode, this would require you to manage each tower with less vigilance, but on higher difficulty, it would be more of a chore than anything else. Assuming you like such activity, it would surely entertain you. Otherwise, I'd suggest you try basic TD games where enemies are passive in action. 

Overall a great game, but if you had played Defense Grid 1 or 2, there is no reason to delve into it, yet. Again, it all boils down to which type of enemies you want: active or passive. That's the only thing different between this and DG. DG however seems to have more varieties overall.
